metadata.title: JSON Output Format Standardization
metadata.description: Standardize compact/pretty JSON formatting across all SDD toolkit CLI commands
objectives: Create centralized JSON output helper in common/json_output.py
Replace all hardcoded json.dumps calls across 7 CLI modules
Ensure consistent behavior with config and flag precedence

metadata.purpose: Create the centralized output_json() helper function that all modules will use

Document function behavior, parameters, and include compact vs pretty examples
Use json.dumps with separators=(',', ':') for compact, indent=2 for pretty
Create unit tests for output_json() covering compact, pretty, and edge cases

journal.title: Task Completed: Analyze existing sdd_update/cli.py implementation
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Successfully analyzed the output_json() implementation in sdd_update/cli.py (lines 56-67).

Key findings:
1. Function signature: output_json(data, compact=False)
2. Takes data to serialize and optional compact flag
3. Uses json.dumps() with conditional formatting:
   - Compact mode: separators=(',', ':') for minimal whitespace
   - Pretty mode: indent=2 for human-readable output
4. Outputs directly to stdout via print()
5. Used throughout the file (19 occurrences) for JSON output in commands
6. Pattern is clean and reusable - perfect candidate for extraction to shared module
7. No error handling in current implementation (should add in shared version)

This analysis confirms the pattern is suitable for standardization. Ready to create the shared common/json_output.py module in task-1-2.

journal.title: Task Completed: Create output_json() function with type hints
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Successfully created output_json() function with proper type hints in common/json_output.py. The function was added to the existing json_output.py module which already had comprehensive JSON formatting utilities.

Key accomplishments:
1. Added output_json(data: Any, compact: bool = False) function (lines 179-209)
2. Function signature matches the pattern from sdd_update/cli.py
3. Properly type-hinted with Any for data parameter and bool for compact
4. Includes comprehensive docstring with examples
5. Delegates to existing format_json_output() for consistent formatting
6. Updated common/__init__.py to export output_json in both import and __all__ list
7. Function integrates seamlessly with existing json_output module infrastructure

The output_json() function provides a simple, standardized interface that matches the naming convention used in sdd_update/cli.py while leveraging the robust implementation in the common module.

journal.title: Task Completed: Add comprehensive docstrings with examples
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Comprehensive docstrings with examples were already added during task-1-2-1. The output_json() function in common/json_output.py (lines 179-209) includes:

1. Clear function description explaining it's the standard output function
2. Args section documenting both parameters with types and defaults
3. Returns section (None, prints to stdout)
4. Examples section with two examples:
   - Pretty-print example showing formatted output with indentation
   - Compact example showing minified JSON output
5. Notes section with implementation details:
   - Naming convention alignment with sdd_update/cli.py
   - Delegation to format_json_output() for consistency
   - Output behavior (stdout for piping/redirection)

The docstring follows Google-style documentation standards and provides complete information for users and developers.

journal.title: Task Completed: Implement compact and pretty-print logic
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Compact and pretty-print logic is fully implemented. The output_json() function delegates to format_json_output() which implements both modes:

Compact mode (lines 81-89):
- Uses json.dumps() with separators=(',', ':') for minimal whitespace
- Removes spaces after commas and colons
- Results in minified JSON output
- Example: {"status":"success","count":42}

Pretty-print mode (lines 90-97):
- Uses json.dumps() with indent=2 for human-readable formatting
- 2-space indentation for nested structures
- Results in formatted JSON output
- Example:
  {
    "status": "success",
    "count": 42
  }

Both modes:
- Use ensure_ascii=False to preserve Unicode characters
- Support optional sort_keys parameter
- Produce valid JSON output

The implementation matches the spec requirements exactly and follows the pattern from sdd_update/cli.py.

journal.title: Task Completed: tests/test_json_output.py
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Created comprehensive unit tests for output_json() in tests/test_json_output.py. All 21 tests pass successfully.

Test coverage includes:

**TestOutputJson class (9 tests):**
- Pretty-print default behavior
- Compact mode output
- Nested data structures
- List data handling
- Empty dict and list edge cases
- Unicode character preservation
- Special JSON values (null, true, false, numbers)
- Compact vs pretty size comparison

**TestFormatJsonOutput class (4 tests):**
- String return type verification
- Pretty mode formatting
- Compact mode formatting  
- sort_keys parameter

**TestPrintJsonOutput class (2 tests):**
- Pretty mode printing
- Compact mode printing

**TestEdgeCases class (5 tests):**
- Non-serializable data error handling
- Very deep nesting (20 levels)
- Large numbers (int64, float extremes)
- Strings with quotes
- Strings with newlines

**TestBackwardCompatibility class (1 test):**
- Signature matches sdd_update/cli.py pattern

All tests verify JSON validity, formatting correctness, and edge case handling. Test file: tests/test_json_output.py (283 lines).

journal.title: Group Completed: File Modifications
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: All child tasks in group phase-1-files have been completed.

journal.title: Task Completed: Unit tests pass for json_output module
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
All unit tests for json_output module pass successfully. Ran pytest tests/test_json_output.py -v with 21 tests, all PASSED in 0.18s.

Test results:
- TestOutputJson: 9/9 tests passed (pretty-print, compact, nested data, lists, empty structures, Unicode, special values, size comparison)
- TestFormatJsonOutput: 4/4 tests passed (string return, pretty/compact modes, sort_keys)
- TestPrintJsonOutput: 2/2 tests passed (pretty and compact printing)
- TestEdgeCases: 5/5 tests passed (non-serializable errors, deep nesting, large numbers, quotes, newlines)
- TestBackwardCompatibility: 1/1 test passed (signature compatibility)

Both compact mode (with separators=(',', ':')) and pretty-print mode (with indent=2) work correctly. All edge cases handled appropriately.

journal.title: Task Completed: Phase 1 implementation fidelity review
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Phase 1 fidelity review completed - 100% compliant with specifications.

Reviewed 5 tasks across Phase 1 (Foundation & Shared Infrastructure):
- task-1-1: Analysis of existing implementation ✅ Exact match
- task-1-2 (with 3 subtasks): json_output.py implementation ✅ Exact match (1 minor positive enhancement)
- task-1-3: Comprehensive test suite ✅ Exact match (exceeded requirements)

Key findings:
1. All specified functionality implemented correctly
2. output_json(data: Any, compact: bool = False) created with proper type hints
3. Function integrated into existing json_output.py module (positive decision)
4. 21 comprehensive unit tests created, all passing
5. Compact mode uses separators=(',', ':'), pretty mode uses indent=2
6. Unicode preservation added as enhancement
7. All implementation decisions properly documented in journals

Deviations: 1 minor positive enhancement (module integration vs new file)
Missing functionality: None
Major issues: None

Recommendation: APPROVE - Phase 1 is production-ready and well-tested. Ready to proceed to Phase 2.

journal.title: Task Completed: Identify all json.dumps calls in high-priority modules
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Successfully identified all json.dumps calls in the three high-priority modules:

**sdd_next/cli.py (11 instances):**
- Lines 271, 604, 844, 881, 902, 941, 975, 1024, 1056, 1093, 1120
- All use indent=2 for pretty-printing
- Cover: task prep, env init, validation, pattern matching, project detection, test discovery, circular deps, related files, path validation, and stats

**sdd_update/cli.py (2 instances) + list_specs.py (2 instances):**
- cli.py lines 65, 67: Compact vs pretty-print based on flags
- list_specs.py lines 136, 138: Compact vs pretty-print based on flags

**sdd_validate/cli.py (4 instances) + diff.py (3 instances) + reporting.py (1 instance) + stats.py (1 instance):**
- cli.py lines 255, 358, 412, 561: All use indent=2
- diff.py lines 260, 268, 495: Mix of pretty-print and compact
- reporting.py line 54: Pretty-print with indent=2
- stats.py line 110: Multi-line json.dumps call

Total: 24 json.dumps calls identified across all three modules. All locations documented with file paths and line numbers. Ready for replacement in subsequent tasks.

journal.title: Task Completed: Add import for output_json
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Successfully added import for output_json function. Added line 36: 'from claude_skills.common.json_output import output_json' after the existing common module imports. Import is now available for replacing all 11 json.dumps calls in this file.
